autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence, when I attribute them solely to my own efforts or determination?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: such as good fortune , success , or happiness
envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would lose their blessings, such as good fortune, success, or happiness?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I harbored discontent when perceiving others' successes, secretly wishing they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: through words inspired by a bad intention
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language, violating their dignity through words inspired by a bad intention?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or hurtful language, potentially violating their dignity and damaging your relationships?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
to neglecting your responsibilities or impacting others
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it led to neglecting your responsibilities or impacting others?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I allow myself to take more than my fair share, indulging in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: to overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Have I permitted my desire for comfort or pleasure to lead me to overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
in conversations at community events , online forums , or social gatherings
at community events , online forums , or social gatherings
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, especially while engaging in conversations at community events, online forums, or social gatherings?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I shared details about others' private lives, even if they were true, for my own amusement or to impress others?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: especially with those closest to me
anger.question: Have I nursed anger rather than seeking reconciliation in my relationships, especially with those closest to me?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
